name: Sales Cloud
description: Salesforce's core CRM for sales teams
justification: Sales Cloud is a primary revenue driver for Salesforce and typically the first product implemented by customers. Analyzing its usage provides critical insights into the ROI of a customer's Salesforce investment.

indicators.description: Primary objects that form the foundation of Sales Cloud
indicators.justification: These objects are the fundamental building blocks of Sales Cloud. Their presence and usage directly indicate whether the organization is using Sales Cloud for its intended purpose. Weights are assigned based on the object's centrality to the sales process.

items.name: Opportunity
items.description: Key object for tracking sales deals - high weight as it's central to Sales Cloud
items.justification: Opportunity tracking is the core functionality of Sales Cloud. Almost no organization can effectively use Sales Cloud without utilizing Opportunities. High weight (0.9) reflects this central importance.

items.name: Lead
items.description: Prospecting object - high weight as it represents top of sales funnel
items.justification: Lead management represents the top of the sales funnel and is critical for most organizations using Sales Cloud. High weight (0.8) reflects its importance, slightly below Opportunities.

items.name: Campaign
items.description: Marketing campaigns object - medium weight as it's often used with Sales Cloud but not essential
items.justification: Campaign tracking bridges sales and marketing but is not essential for all Sales Cloud implementations. Medium weight (0.5) reflects its optional nature while still being a significant indicator when used.

items.name: Quote
items.description: Quote generation - medium-high weight as it indicates advanced sales process
items.justification: Quote management indicates a more sophisticated sales process that includes formal pricing and proposals. Medium-high weight (0.6) reflects that it's an important indicator of more complete Sales Cloud adoption.

items.name: Product2
items.description: Product catalog - indicates more advanced use of Sales Cloud
items.justification: Product catalog usage shows the organization has formalized their offerings within Salesforce. Weight (0.6) reflects that this is an important indicator of structured sales processes.

items.name: PriceBook2
items.description: Price books for products - indicates more advanced use of Sales Cloud
items.justification: Price book configuration indicates sophisticated pricing strategies managed in Sales Cloud. Medium weight (0.5) reflects that it's significant but often implemented after core functionality.

indicators.justification: Configured sales processes indicate that an organization has tailored Sales Cloud to their specific business needs, which strongly correlates with successful adoption and long-term usage.

items.name: Custom Sales Process
items.description: Custom sales stages indicate organization has tailored Sales Cloud to their process
items.justification: Organizations that configure custom sales processes show commitment to aligning Salesforce with their business. High weight (0.7) because this customization is a strong indicator of serious platform adoption.

items.name: Lead Assignment Rules
items.description: Lead routing indicates active lead management process
items.justification: Lead assignment rules show process automation and distributed sales responsibility. Medium-high weight (0.6) as this indicates structured lead handling processes.

items.name: Web-to-Lead
items.description: Web lead capture shows digital lead generation strategy
items.justification: Web-to-Lead indicates digital integration with marketing efforts. Medium weight (0.5) as it shows expanded usage beyond core CRM but isn't essential for all businesses.

items.name: Opportunity Record Types
items.description: Multiple opportunity types indicate advanced sales segmentation
items.justification: Multiple opportunity record types indicate sophisticated sales categorization. Medium-high weight (0.6) as this reflects a mature Sales Cloud implementation with differentiated processes.

indicators.justification: Advanced features indicate deeper platform adoption and are typically implemented after core functionality is established. Their presence strongly indicates committed, long-term Sales Cloud usage.

items.name: Forecasting
items.description: Sales forecasting is a key advanced Sales Cloud feature
items.justification: Forecasting represents strategic usage of Sales Cloud for business planning. High weight (0.7) as it indicates the organization is using Salesforce for business intelligence, not just transaction tracking.

items.name: Collaborative Forecasts
items.description: Advanced forecasting feature indicates mature sales operations
items.justification: Collaborative forecasting indicates team-based sales planning and management. Medium-high weight (0.6) as it shows advanced forecasting utilization.

items.name: Einstein Lead Scoring
items.description: AI feature shows advanced Sales Cloud implementation
items.justification: Einstein adoption indicates investment in AI-enhanced sales processes. Very high weight (0.8) as it represents cutting-edge Sales Cloud usage and substantial investment in the platform.

items.name: Enterprise Territory Management
items.description: Territory management indicates complex sales organization
items.justification: Territory management indicates sophisticated sales team organization. High weight (0.7) as it shows deep commitment to managing complex sales operations in Salesforce.

items.name: Opportunity Teams
items.description: Team selling approach indicates collaborative sales process
items.justification: Opportunity Teams indicates collaborative selling processes. Medium-high weight (0.6) as it shows more sophisticated team selling approach.

items.name: Sales Engagement
items.description: High velocity sales shows advanced outreach capabilities
items.justification: Sales Engagement (High Velocity Sales) represents investment in premium sales acceleration tools. Very high weight (0.8) as it indicates significant financial commitment to Salesforce sales capabilities.

indicators.description: Evidence of active usage by sales users
indicators.justification: User activity is perhaps the strongest indicator of genuine adoption. Configuration without actual usage doesn't deliver business value, so these behavioral signals are weighted heavily.

items.name: Opportunity Views
items.description: Direct evidence of sales reps working deals
items.justification: Opportunity views provide direct evidence that sales representatives are actively using the system to manage deals. High weight (0.8) because this is one of the strongest behavioral indicators of adoption.

items.name: Lead Views
items.description: Evidence of prospecting activity
items.justification: Lead views indicate active prospecting and lead management. High weight (0.7) as this represents front-of-funnel engagement with the CRM.

items.name: Sales Dashboard Views
items.description: Evidence of sales performance monitoring
items.justification: Dashboard usage indicates management oversight and metric-driven sales processes. Medium-high weight (0.6) as it shows Sales Cloud being used for performance analytics.

items.name: Sales Reports
items.description: Evidence of sales analytics usage
items.justification: Report usage indicates data-driven sales management. Medium-high weight (0.6) as it shows analytical usage of Sales Cloud data.

indicators.description: Evidence of Sales Cloud being integrated with other systems
indicators.justification: Integrations indicate that Sales Cloud has been embedded into the broader technology ecosystem, which correlates with strategic commitment and lower churn risk.

items.name: Email Integration
items.description: Email tracking shows Sales Cloud integrated into communication
items.justification: Email integration embeds Salesforce into daily communication workflows. High weight (0.7) as this greatly increases user adoption by bringing CRM into core productivity tools.

items.name: Calendar Sync
items.description: Calendar integration shows Sales Cloud used for meeting management
items.justification: Calendar sync integrates Salesforce with another daily workflow tool. Medium weight (0.5) as it enhances adoption but isn't as critical as email integration.

items.name: CTI Integration
items.description: Phone system integration indicates advanced usage
items.justification: CTI integration shows investment in connecting telephony with CRM. Medium-high weight (0.6) as it requires additional implementation effort and budget.

items.name: Opportunity API Calls
items.description: API integration with Opportunity object indicates programmatic sales process
items.justification: API integration indicates Salesforce is being used programmatically, often with other enterprise systems. High weight (0.7) as it represents significant technical investment and importance to business processes.

indicators.description: Evidence of custom code interacting with Sales Cloud
indicators.justification: Custom code development represents significant investment in tailoring Salesforce to specific business needs, indicating deep commitment to the platform.

items.name: Opportunity Triggers
items.description: Custom Apex on opportunities indicates advanced customization
items.justification: Apex triggers on Opportunities show deep technical customization of core sales processes. High weight (0.7) as this represents significant development investment.

items.name: Lead Triggers
items.description: Custom lead processing logic indicates specialized lead handling
items.justification: Apex triggers on Leads indicate customized lead processing. Medium-high weight (0.6) shows importance but slightly less central than Opportunity customization.

items.name: Sales Cloud Lightning Components
items.description: Custom UI components for Sales Cloud indicates deep customization
items.justification: Custom Lightning components show investment in tailored user experiences. Medium-high weight (0.6) indicates significant UI customization effort.

editionJustification: Edition detection is based on feature availability and usage patterns. Features are mapped to the editions where they first become available, with more advanced features appearing in higher editions. This helps identify both the currently licensed edition and potential upgrade paths.

coreObjects.Opportunity: Core Opportunity management is in use

features.Custom Sales Process: Sales process has been customized for your business needs
features.Web-to-Lead: Web lead capture is enabled for digital lead generation
features.Einstein Lead Scoring: Einstein AI is being used for lead scoring
features.Enterprise Territory Management: Advanced territory management is in use
features.Sales Engagement: High velocity sales capabilities are being utilized

findingsJustification: Findings are mapped directly to detected evidence points, translating technical detection into business-meaningful insights. Each finding is phrased to be actionable and understandable by non-technical stakeholders.
